text: Blowgun demonstration in Oconaluftee Indian Village, Cherokee, North Carolina The Oconaluftee Indian Village is a replica of an 18th-century eastern Cherokee community located in Cherokee, North Carolina, United States along the Oconaluftee River. The Cherokee "living museum" is operated by the Cherokee Historical Association. Guides take visitors through the village explaining the history and culture of the Cherokee and also demonstrate the making of such items as arrowheads, baskets, and blowguns. == See also == * Unto These Hills * Cherokee Botanical Garden and Nature Trail * Eastern Band of Cherokee Indians == External links == * Cherokee Adventure website * Oconaluftee River Trail, Visit Cherokee County website Category:Cherokee culture Category:Eastern Band of Cherokee Indians Category:Museums in Swain County, North Carolina Category:History of the Cherokee Category:Living museums in North Carolina Category:Native American museums in North Carolina Category:Ethnographic museums in the United States
title: Oconaluftee Indian Village
